prompt: 100 students: 40 play cricket, 30 play football, 25 play hockey. 15 play cricket and football, 10 play football and hockey, 8 play cricket and hockey, 5 play all three. How many play only cricket?
In 3-set Venn, total in at least one set = A+B+C - (A∩B) - (B∩C) - (A∩C) + ?
Sets A, B, C: A has 20, B has 15, C has 10. A∩B=5, B∩C=4, A∩C=3, A∩B∩C=2. Find A∪B∪C.
In a survey: 50 like A, 40 like B, 30 like C. 20 like A&B, 15 like B&C, 10 like A&C, 8 like all. How many like exactly two?
60 students: 25 like Maths, 22 like Science, 20 like English. 10 like M&S, 8 like S&E, 6 like M&E, 4 like all. How many like none?
In Venn diagram of three sets, the center region represents?
explanation: Center where all three overlap = A∩B∩C.

prompt: A survey: 35 read Hindi paper, 28 read English, 24 read Regional. 12 read H&E, 10 read E&R, 8 read H&R, 5 read all. How many read only Hindi?
For three sets A, B, C: If someone is in exactly one set, they are in region of?
answers: A only, B only, or C only
explanation: Exactly one means only in one set, not overlapping.

prompt: 80 people: 50 like tea, 40 like coffee, 30 like juice. 20 like tea & coffee, 15 like coffee & juice, 12 like tea & juice, 8 like all. Find those liking only tea.
In a club: 45 play tennis, 38 play badminton, 32 play squash. 18 play T&B, 14 play B&S, 12 play T&S, 7 play all. Total in at least one sport?
Three subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Biology. 40 take P, 35 take C, 30 take B. 15 take P&C, 12 take C&B, 10 take P&B, 6 take all. How many take exactly one subject?
If A, B, C are three sets and n(A∪B∪C) = 100, n(A)=n(B)=n(C)=50, n(A∩B)=n(B∩C)=n(A∩C)=20, find n(A∩B∩C).
What is represented by the regions outside all three circles in a Venn diagram?
answers: Elements in none of the sets
explanation: Region outside all circles represents elements not in any of A, B, or C.

prompt: n(A)=15, n(B)=12, n(C)=10, n(A∩B∩C)=2. If sets are such that total in at least one = 30. Find sum of pairwise intersections.
